Windows 11 - Microsoft (MS) Windows 11 release (ft. Windows 10 upgrade) When will it be released?

Microsoft (MS ) released Windows 11

Microsoft has released Windows 11. The actual release date will be revealed at the end of this year (2021).

Connectivity, productivity, and gaming platform are emphasized as the characteristics of Windows 11. Personally, I feel that the direction of the existing new OS is different from the main functions.

[] (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uh9643c2P6k)

Features 1. Improved user convenience

It seems that a lot of effort has been put into the connection between user convenience (UX) and services. (Recently, MS has changed.) It seems that they did a lot of benchmarking with Google and Apple. It doesn't feel like I've seen it anywhere else, but it also has a lot of Microsoft's feel to it.

Feature 2. Enhance connectivity between services

As is already known, the IE browser stopped development and Edge was introduced as the default browser.

However, internally, Google/Chrome/Google Calendar is based on the linkage, so it does not seem to stick to only the company's browser.

In addition, Apple's FaceTime, a competitor, was installed as standard, and at the same time, Microsoft's own collaboration platform Teams and Teams-based services were introduced.

Feature 3. Game platform support

Served as a gaming platform. It is said that if you have Game Pass, an XBox subscription service, you can play games the same as XBox.

By the way, if this happens, you need to buy an XBox....

(I am using XBox and Ultimate Game Pass. TT_TT)

Version compatibility - Windows 10 upgrade support?

First of all, Windows 10 users get a free upgrade. However, there are two conditions.

1) Environment: Windows 11 installable specifications (more than the minimum required hardware specifications below)

  • Hardware requirement check tool: https://aka.ms/GetPCHealthCheckApp

    Processor: 1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster with two or more cores on a compatible 64-bit processor or system on a chip (SoC).

RAM: 4 gigabytes (GB) or greater.

Storage: 64 GB* or greater available storage is required to install Windows 11. Additional storage space might be required to download updates and enable specific features.

Graphics card: Compatible with DirectX 12 or later, with a WDDM 2.0 driver.

System firmware: UEFI, Secure Boot capable.

TPM: Trusted Platform Module (TPM) version 2.0.

Display: High definition (720p) display, 9" or greater monitor, 8 bits per color channel. Internet connection: Internet connectivity is necessary to perform updates, and to download and use some features.

Windows 11 Home edition requires an Internet connection and a Microsoft Account to complete device setup on first use.

#### 2) Timing: Expected to be available only in 2022 (to be announced a gradual upgrade version for each platform)

If you do not meet the minimum system requirements,,,? You can continue to use Windows 10. It was announced that Windows 10 will  be maintained until October 14, 2025. 



## MS corporate value
Thanks to the announcement of Windows 11, Teams, and Azure, Microsoft's enterprise value has reached an all-time high (as of Thursday, June 24). Even in the stock market news and the Investing.com forum, the dominant opinion is that Microsoft will rise further. 

![Buy Microsoft and The highest price](https://img1.daumcdn.net/thumb/R1280x0/?scode=mtistory2&fname=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.kakaocdn.net%2Fdn%2Fd9iUGk%2Fbtq79kSBNNg%2F4BojFGq5CE3OCMTzo0OTA0%2Fimg.png)

As a shareholder of Microsoft, I am very happy that Microsoft is changing positively and its corporate value is rising. I look forward to becoming a growing MS (MSFT) in the future. 


![MSFT Stock Price by Investing.com](https://img1.daumcdn.net/thumb/R1280x0/?scode=mtistory2&fname=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.kakaocdn.net%2Fdn%2FdrbiCk%2Fbtq8atgIlZG%2FaZSNtXFXd5NyDMpG6G0mk0%2Fimg.png)
